name: Vegan Tiramisu
description: The rich and decadent flavors in this Vegan Tiramisu will have you going back for seconds. Itâ€™s an uncomplicated recipe that can be done days ahead of time or all at once. Simple ingredients only!
recipeIngredient: (2) 8-ounce containers vegan cream cheese (16 oz total)
1/4 cup coconut oil (use refined for NO coconut flavor)
1/2 cup full fat coconut milk, the white creamy part only
4-6  shots strong espresso or coffee (about 1 cup)
2 tablespoons cocoa powder, for dusting the top

itemListElement.text: Heat oven to 350 degrees F and grease an 10x15 inch sheet pan (9x13 inches would work if needed).
itemListElement.name: Heat oven to 350 degrees F and grease an 10x15 inch sheet pan (9x13 inches would work if needed).

itemListElement.text: In a large bowl, add the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, salt and sugar. Whisk well to combine.To the bowl with the dry ingredients, pour in the oil, soy milk, apple cider vinegar and vanilla extract. Mix with a large spoon until just combined, but be careful not to over mix the batter or your cake won't be soft and fluffy.
itemListElement.name: In a large bowl, add the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, salt and sugar. Whisk well to combine.To the bowl with the dry ingredients, pour in the oil, soy milk, apple cider vinegar and vanilla extract. Mix with a large spoon until just combined, but be careful not to over mix the batter or your cake won't be soft and fluffy.

itemListElement.text: Pour into the prepared pan and bake for 25-30 minutes. If using a 9x13 inch pan, it will need to bake for 40 minutes or so. Check with a toothpick to ensure doneness.
itemListElement.name: Pour into the prepared pan and bake for 25-30 minutes. If using a 9x13 inch pan, it will need to bake for 40 minutes or so. Check with a toothpick to ensure doneness.

itemListElement.text: Let the cake cool, then slice into strips about 1 1/2 inches wide. You will have some leftover cake pieces, which are lovely to have with tea or as a fun snack. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: Let the cake cool, then slice into strips about 1 1/2 inches wide. You will have some leftover cake pieces, which are lovely to have with tea or as a fun snack. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: To a food processor (or blender), add the vegan cream cheese, sugar, coconut oil, vanilla, coconut milk and a tiny pinch of salt. Mix or blend until smooth, then place in the freezer for 15-20 minutes. It will firm up somewhat due to the coconut oil.
itemListElement.name: To a food processor (or blender), add the vegan cream cheese, sugar, coconut oil, vanilla, coconut milk and a tiny pinch of salt. Mix or blend until smooth, then place in the freezer for 15-20 minutes. It will firm up somewhat due to the coconut oil.

itemListElement.text: In a small bowl, stir together the espresso or strong coffee, liquor and sugar. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: In a small bowl, stir together the espresso or strong coffee, liquor and sugar. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Get out an 8x8 inch pan or tall dish. Dip the cake strips into the espresso mixture and place a layer in the bottom of the pan. Layer on half of the creamy mixture. Add another layer of espresso dipped cake pieces, then the rest of cream and refrigerate.
itemListElement.name: Get out an 8x8 inch pan or tall dish. Dip the cake strips into the espresso mixture and place a layer in the bottom of the pan. Layer on half of the creamy mixture. Add another layer of espresso dipped cake pieces, then the rest of cream and refrigerate.

itemListElement.text: Refrigerate for several hours or overnight if possible to let the cream firm up and the flavors to mingle.
itemListElement.name: Refrigerate for several hours or overnight if possible to let the cream firm up and the flavors to mingle.

itemListElement.text: After chilling for several hours or overnight, dust with cocoa powder (I used a sifter for this). Slice and serve.
itemListElement.name: After chilling for several hours or overnight, dust with cocoa powder (I used a sifter for this). Slice and serve.
